reference.title: Common Formatting Types Used on a Typewriter
reference.shortdesc: Typewriters are often used today for addressing formal documents, filling out pre-printed forms, or maintaining security in the production of highly confidential, sensitive materials. All of these options have different formatting.

entry.p: Papers have 1 inch margins, text is left justified with no first line indentation, single spaced with an extra space between paragraphs.
Text is left justified, single spaced, and fully capitalized.
Papers have 1 inch margins. Body text is double spaced and left justified with the first line indented. Titles are centered and references contain hanging indentation.
Papers have 1 inch margins with varied line spacing.
Margins and spacing vary as chosen by the writer.
